snippet: Comptroller Scott M. Stringer is recommending investing in technology to track repairs in public housing similar to the CompStat program that the Police Department uses to map and respond to crime.
abstract: Audit conducted by New York City Comptroller Scott M Stringer finds that many repairs in public housing are still being made at lumbering pace, and recommends city invest in technology to track work.
lead_paragraph: Comptroller Scott M. Stringer is recommending investing in technology to track repairs in public housing similar to the CompStat program that the Police Department uses to map and respond to crime.

headline.main: New York City Public Housing Has Pileup of Repairs, Comptroller’s Audit Finds
headline.print_headline: City Housing Has Pileup of Repairs, Audit Finds
